As an AI language model, it is not possible for me to know what location you are in, so it is difficult to provide specific advice. However, here are some general tips on caring for a holly tree during harsh winters:

1. Water the holly tree deeply before the ground freezes, to ensure the roots have enough moisture to survive the winter.

2. Mulch around the base of the tree to provide insulation and protect the roots during cold snaps.

3. Protect the tree from frost cracks by wrapping the trunk with burlap or other protective material.

4. Prune the tree lightly in late winter or early spring to remove any damaged or diseased wood.

5. Avoid using salt to melt ice near the tree, as this can damage the roots and foliage. 

6. If you are in an area with frequent and heavy snow, gently remove snow that has accumulated on the branches to prevent them from breaking under the weight. 

7. If you see any signs of damage or stress on your holly tree during the winter, such as wilting, discoloration or leaf drop, contact a professional arborist for advice on how to protect your tree.
